Title: "Hope is a Meager Substitute for Success"

scenes.label: Elder Baker walking to his shop sees a boy being beaten
scenes.notes:
IF POSSIBLE: the baker looks like a giant, can his proportion be slightly smaller?

The way he is walking looks like he is walking on air rather than the pavement, it does not mesh into the scene cleanly, this is a known issue with the video tech and over time we need to improve.

Scene Observations:
The voice and the scene are in sync: Good
The feet don't have shadow, so it looks like he is floating.
The baker has perspective, but as he gets bigger, he does start to look like a giant compared to the building on the left.

Another visual discrepency may be because the scene is misty morning but the characters are hard focussed.

Video Observations:

Character vs Background, both a Studio Ghibli French 1930 style, but the backgrounds are soft pencil and kind of blured while the characters are hard pencil and more cartoonish, and when creating video is important that we alignment early in the processs or we use an AI tool that solves that at generation.

scenes.label: He shouts, and the gang of kids run off
scenes.notes:
This scene is good to go

Observation: 

The perspective in this scene is the best in the video and thus the gold standard when thinking about proportion

The layout (such as the fence) is different from the scene before.

scenes.label: I have no parents, I’m all alone
scenes.notes:
Observation:

The look of concern is awesome by the baker

IS this fixable:
but the talking both before and after the look is not realistic

At the 40 to 41 second mark, it would be better if the baker stood then listening rather then being so in your face trying to commuicate with the boy, he looks like he is leaning in and conversing when he should just be listening.

scenes.label: Would you like to make Bread
The boy watches as the baker works
Sprinkles Flour on Wooden Table
scenes.notes:
Observation:

I think we don't want to change the scene the same seems wrong. The we've got issues with the graphics of the sprinkling of the flower anyway with a hand going upwards so what were you really? Should do is go back to the previous scene add various items to the table like we have in this scene and then have him sprinkling flour in a more realistic fashion.

scenes.label: Baker Smiles gives the Boy a Gift of the Bread
The Boy Thanks the Baker and Exits the Shop
Sitting in the Alley eating Bread
Walking down the Street, sees a Crowd and Boy being Arrested
Askes to See the Boy, Jailer gives Permission
In cell Baker askes Boy, “What Happened”
Boy tells Baker while Eating the Bread the other Boys saw Him
On the last day, the Boy Receives a Visitor
The Kind Baker brings the boy bread
The Boy takes the Bread, and the Baker Speaks to the Boy
Do you Remember the Night, I told you about the Miracle of the Bread
The Rising of the Bread in the Pan and in the Oven
Be Strong, you too shall rise like the bread
It’s been Foretold, Bread is the Body of Christ
Which all gain nourishment and life
